We are planning on visiting Sri Lanka in June, we  think about staying somewhere around Bentota.
Iâ€™ve heard alot of different opinions, that it might be raining al the time, or that the weather should be nice and if the rain appears it takes just a moment, and it gets sunny back quickly.

ğŸš¨ Sri Lanka - CYCLONE UPDATE
Sri Lanka has experienced a rare November cyclone landfall; only the 5th recorded and the first since 1992. Tropical Storm Ditwah, reaching 40 mph (65 km/h) and 1,001 mbar, is moving across the island and has already triggered devastating landslides and dangerous flash floods.
Tragically, 47 lives have been lost, and more than 25 people remain unaccounted for.
At the same time, Tropical Depression Senyar, located about 1,400 miles (2,250 km) to the east, continues to bring heavy flooding to Sumatra and Malaysia.

ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡° Sri Lanka (Mother Land) Faces Severe Weather Impact
In the latest severe windstorm that struck Sri Lanka, approximately 7.16% of the population has been affected, marking one of the most significant climate related events in recent years. The devastation has resulted in 465 confirmed deaths, with 366 individuals still reported missing.
Beyond the heartbreaking human loss, thousands of families have been displaced, infrastructure has been damaged, and essential services across multiple districts have been disrupted. This tragedy highlights a growing reality: extreme weather events are no longer rare they are becoming the new normal.
My thoughts and prayers are with all the affected families. Let us stand together in contributing to relief efforts and advocating for stronger climate resilience across the country.

climate in sri lanka .
Today, Friday, November 28, 2025, Sri Lanka is experiencing heavy rain and strong winds, with some sources indicating a 'Red' alert for a potential cyclone. Widespread flooding has already resulted in numerous casualties and disruptions across multiple regions.
ğŸŒ§ï¸ National Weather Warning
The Department of Meteorology has issued a 'Red' alert for land and sea areas around the island as a deep depression southeast of Sri Lanka is likely to intensify into a cyclone. This has led to severe weather conditions, including significant flooding and traffic disruptions.
ğŸ“ Weather in Colombo
The capital city is experiencing persistent and heavy rain throughout the day and night.
Current Conditions (approx. morning hours): The temperature is around 23Â°C (73Â°F) to 25Â°C (77Â°F), with humidity near 98%. Winds are strong, coming from the northwest at speeds of up to 40 mph (64 km/h) with higher gusts.
Today's Forecast: Expect a high of approximately 26Â°C (80Â°F) and a low of 22Â°C (74Â°F). The chance of rain is 100%, with several inches of rainfall expected throughout the day.
Outlook: Heavy rain is expected to continue into the night, with conditions gradually improving slightly by Saturday, though passing showers will remain a possibility.
ğŸ—ºï¸ Regional Conditions
Other cities are also affected by the adverse weather:
Galle, Ratnapura, and Pitipana North are all reporting rain or sprinkles.
Rain, becoming heavy at times, is also forecast in areas like Hiruwalamulla, Gampaha District.
For the most up-to-date information, it is recommended to check the official Department of Meteorology website or a trusted weather source like AccuWeather.
